Articles.Content: I know that this is not a big accomplishment for all of the guys that have been playing this game for years, but i have finally gotten my first space craft into orbit around kerbin. Yay.
Well done! You will be on the Mun in no time!

YES! GOOD......good.....

Now that your minds control ship is in space dominating the planet is just a button away.

Personally I'd skip the Mun and go to Minmus, it's not that much further out, and it's far easier to land on.

Edited January 26, 2015 by aleis
Congratulations! You've just taken your first step into a bigger world.

Yay indeed.

Get on board this thread and share some screenshots of your crafts too, if you like - I love comparing crafts from long time players and newcomers, it shows everyone where we all started out and where we might go - or even baffle us, how different our approaches to the game are/were.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today
Amazing !! To the mun next and beyond really well done sir.
That's awesome.

I still remember, and cherish the feeling of pushing the Pe node just above 70 km.

Welcome.

Wait until he docks for the 1st time.

(I jumped out of my chair, walking around the room pumping my fists saying Yes! yes! yes!)

Wait until he docks for the 1st time.

(I jumped out of my chair, walking around the room pumping my fists saying Yes! yes! yes!)

sounds like my first time I actually docked two space craft together. I used to pretty good at it. I seemed to have gotten pretty rusty at it though

Congrats. It's a big accomplishment. Figuring out how to orbit is not just a first step, but it's the biggest because once you have a grasp of how to manipulate your orbit, you basically open the door to go anywhere.

Congratulations! You've just taken your first step into a bigger world.

Nope.. his first step towars smaller worlds...

They are all smaller than Kerbin, except for Jool, and while Eve is hard to return from... its pretty much impossible to come back from near the "surface" of Jool.

Go to Mun orbit next!

Then Minmus! then land on Minmus (its much easier than the Mun!)

Then go to Eve orbit (you can go down if you want, but at this point for you, its likely a 1 way ticket!).

Then Duna, then land on duna and come back.

Then go explore the Jool system...

Take a spaceplane to laythe... Laythe is fun.

Congrats!

You'll be on the Mun in no time at all.

Protip: Don't forget batteries!

Thanks for the support,

- - - Updated - - -

Thanks a lot alshain

- - - Updated - - -

Okay sure will, Thanks.

Congratulations.

But... no pictures?

(Also, moved to mission reports.)

Thanks to everybody for the support, Mun here we come

- - - Updated - - -

Thanks Worir4 now i have 3 orbiting around kerbin and 1 long range space ship i call it the orbiter 3 Mk II witch orbits around the sun.

Just head for that small moon....

Wait, that's no moon...

You'll be there in no time!

Congratulations! I remember getting to orbit for the first time (in the demo), then achieving it much easier in the full version. Every achievement should be taken as a huge milestone, remember that. Never think of what you do as insignificant... trust me
Congratulations, the race to evolve has begun...er..wait... wrong game.

Good job, Darth. And welcome to the forum. Have a kerbal snack.

Remember to take a picture next time so you can look back on your beginnings.
Congratulations.
